  <script>
    (function () {
      const generateUUID = () =>
        "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx".replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
          const r = (Math.random() * 16) | 0;
          const v = c === "x" ? r : (r & 0x3) | 0x8;
          return v.toString(16);
        });
  
      let isLocalStorageAvailable = false;
      const isAvailable = () => {
        if (isLocalStorageAvailable) {
          return true;
        }
  
        try {
          const x = "__storage_test__";
          window.localStorage.setItem(x, x);
          window.localStorage.removeItem(x);
          isLocalStorageAvailable = true;
          return true;
        } catch (e) {
          return false;
        }
      };
  
      const unsafeSetItem = (key, value) => {
        window.localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(value));
      };
  
      const unsafeGetItem = (key) => {
        return JSON.parse(window.localStorage.getItem(key) || "null");
      };
  
      const setSafeItem = (key, value) => {
        if (isAvailable()) {
          unsafeSetItem(key, value);
        }
      };
  
      const getSafeItem = (key, defaultValue) => {
        return isAvailable() ? unsafeGetItem(key) : defaultValue;
      };
  
      const ANA_UID_KEY = "ana_uid";
      let currentUid = getSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, "");
      if (!currentUid) {
        currentUid = generateUUID();
        setSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, currentUid);
      }
      window.getAnaUid = () => currentUid;
    })();
  </script>

  <script>
  function initialize_wunderkind(d) {
    window.addEventListener('load', function() {
      var e = d.createElement('script');
      e.src = d.location.protocol + '//tag.wknd.ai/5453/i.js';
      e.async = true;
      d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
    });
  }

  function determine_wunderkind_eligibility() {
    if (window.location.search.includes('enable_wunderkind')) {
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
      return;
    }

    let wunderkind_segment = 0;
    try { wunderkind_segment = localStorage.getItem('genius_wunderkind_segment'); } catch (e) {}

    if (typeof(wunderkind_segment) === 'string') {
      wunderkind_segment = Number(wunderkind_segment);
    } else {
      wunderkind_segment = Math.random();
      try { localStorage.setItem('genius_wunderkind_segment', wunderkind_segment); } catch (e) {}
    }

    if ((wunderkind_segment * 100) < 100.0) {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'wunderkind';
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
    } else {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'control';
    }
  }

  determine_wunderkind_eligibility();
</script>

class="About__Container-ut4i9m-1 eSiFpi"><h1 font-size="xxLargeHeadline" class="About__Title-ut4i9m-2 kdlPmS">About</h1><div class="SongDescription__Container-sc-615rvk-0 hGCjqh"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dicydA"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span>Genius Annotation</span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">13 contributors</button></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__Container-sc-1165iv-0 ikywhQ"><div class="ExpandableContent__Content-sc-1165iv-4 huhsMa"><div class="SongDescription__Content-sc-615rvk-2 kRzyD"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 jaueyy"><p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href="https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/38300">8 Mile</a></em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.</p>

<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone</em> <a href="https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300" rel="noopener nofollow">in 2003</a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href="https://genius.com/5140246" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/referents/5140245">shed doubt on</a>.</p>

<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href="https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am" rel="noopener nofollow"><em>The Way I Am</em></a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile</em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)</p>

<p>In 2014, the <a href="https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/586290">demo version</a> appeared on Shady Records' <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/114275"><em>SHADY XV</em></a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.</p>

<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href="https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/329470">“I Will Always Love You”</a> and <a href="https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/51652">“End Of The Road”</a>). As of 2022, it is <a href="https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF" rel="noopener nofollow">13x Multi-Platinum</a> in the US.</p>

<p>The song was lauded critically, too. It won <a href="https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards" rel="noopener nofollow">two Grammys</a> (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for <a href="http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003" rel="noopener nofollow">Best Original Song</a>. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href="https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173" rel="noopener nofollow">didn’t think</a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was <a href="https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/" rel="noopener nofollow">remedied</a> when he performed the song at the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA" rel="noopener nofollow">2020 Oscars</a>.</p>

<p>The song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for <a href="https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot" rel="noopener nofollow">two commercials</a> in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM" rel="noopener nofollow">“Born of Fire”</a> Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw" rel="noopener nofollow">own fan-made song.</a>)</p></div></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__ButtonContainer-sc-1165iv-3 laPHmj"><button class="Button__Container-rtu9rw-0 gexBFu src=\'//genius.com/songs/207/embed.js\'><\/script>\",\"descriptionPreview\":\"“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie 8 Mile. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told Rolling Stone in 2003 that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since shed doubt on.\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, The Way I Am, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for 8 Mile] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the demo version appeared on Shady Records\' SHADY XV compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind “I Will Always Love You” and “End Of The Road”). As of 2022, it is 13x Multi-Platinum in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won two Grammys (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for Best Original Song. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he didn’t think he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was remedied when he performed the song at the 2020 Oscars.\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for two commercials in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 “Born of Fire” Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its own fan-made song.)\",\"description\":{\"markdown\":\"\\\"Lose Yourself\\\" is the theme song from Eminem\'s semi-biographical 2002 movie *[8 Mile](http://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile)*. Eminem is narrating the life of the film\'s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem\'s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told *Rolling Stone* [in 2003](https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:\$002f\$002f1657660369\$002f0\$002fazh\$007c\$007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5\$002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl\$002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs\$003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300) that Eminem \\\"laid down all three verses in one take\\\", which Eminem has since [shed doubt on](http://genius.com/5140246).\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, [*The Way I Am*](https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am), that he wrote \\\"in-between shooting scenes [for *8 Mile*] and taking care of [his] kids\\\" (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the [demo version](https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics) appeared on Shady Records\' [*SHADY XV*](http://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv) compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, \\\"Lose Yourself\\\" was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem\'s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind [\\\"I Will Always Love You\\\"](https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics) and [\\\"End Of The Road\\\"](https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics)). As of 2022, it is [13x Multi-Platinum](https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF) in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won [two Grammys](https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards) (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for [Best Original Song](http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003). Eminem didn\'t attend the ceremony as he [didn\'t think](https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173) he\'d win, meaning he didn\'t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was [remedied](https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/) when he performed the song at the [2020 Oscars](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA).\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for [two commercials](https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot) in the mid-\'00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 [\\\"Born of Fire\\\"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM) Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that\'s been meme\'d extensively (even being given its [own fan-made song.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw))\",\"html\":\"<p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/38300\\\">8 Mile<\/a><\/em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone<\/em> <a href=\\\"https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">in 2003<\/a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/5140246\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/referents/5140245\\\">shed doubt on<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href=\\\"https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\"><em>The Way I Am<\/em><\/a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile<\/em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)<\/p>\\n\\n<p>In 2014, the <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/586290\\\">demo version<\/a> appeared on Shady Records\' <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/114275\\\"><em>SHADY XV<\/em><\/a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/329470\\\">“I Will Always Love You”<\/a> and <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/51652\\\">“End Of The Road”<\/a>). As of 2022, it is <a href=\\\"https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">13x Multi-Platinum<\/a> in the US.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song was lauded critically, too. It won <a href=\\\"https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two Grammys<\/a> (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for <a href=\\\"http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">Best Original Song<\/a>. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href=\\\"https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">didn’t think<\/a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. Then, in August I participated in and won my first clean-up championship and hit 50,000 IQ. I went on to win the September and October championships as well.\\n\\nIn September, I designed a new cover art for and became a co-host to the Get Involved! community series with ed Scopey, posting biweekly prompts for the Genius community to share about themselves. Eminem is narrating…” —@Genius\",\"state\":\"accepted\",\"source\":null,\"shareUrl\":\"https://genius.com/3489948\",\"referentId\":3489948,\"pyongsCount\":7,\"proposedEditCount\":0,\"pinned\":false,\"needsExegesis\":false,\"id\":3489948,\"hasVoters\":true,\"embedContent\":\"<blockquote class=\'rg_standalone_container\' data-src=\'//genius.com/annotations/3489948/standalone_embed\'><a href=\'https://genius.com/3489948/Eminem-lose-yourself/Lose-yourself\'>Lose Yourself<\/a><br><a href=\'https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-lyrics\'>― Eminem – Lose Yourself<\/a><\/blockquote><script async crossorigin src=\'//genius.com/annotations/load_standalone_embeds.js\'><\/script>\",\"deleted\":false,\"customPreview\":null,\"createdAt\":1267583121,\"community\":true,\"commentCount\":3,\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"\\\"Lose Yourself\\\" is the theme song from Eminem\'s semi-biographical 2002 movie *[8 Mile](http://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile)*. Eminem is narrating the life of the film\'s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem\'s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told *Rolling Stone* [in 2003](https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:\$002f\$002f1657660369\$002f0\$002fazh\$007c\$007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5\$002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl\$002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs\$003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300) that Eminem \\\"laid down all three verses in one take\\\", which Eminem has since [shed doubt on](http://genius.com/5140246).\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, [*The Way I Am*](https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am), that he wrote \\\"in-between shooting scenes [for *8 Mile*] and taking care of [his] kids\\\" (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the [demo version](https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics) appeared on Shady Records\' [*SHADY XV*](http://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv) compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, \\\"Lose Yourself\\\" was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem\'s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind [\\\"I Will Always Love You\\\"](https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics) and [\\\"End Of The Road\\\"](https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics)). As of 2022, it is [13x Multi-Platinum](https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF) in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won [two Grammys](https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards) (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for [Best Original Song](http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003). Eminem didn\'t attend the ceremony as he [didn\'t think](https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173) he\'d win, meaning he didn\'t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was [remedied](https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/) when he performed the song at the [2020 Oscars](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA).\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for [two commercials](https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot) in the mid-\'00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 [\\\"Born of Fire\\\"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM) Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that\'s been meme\'d extensively (even being given its [own fan-made song.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw))\",\"html\":\"<p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/38300\\\">8 Mile<\/a><\/em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone<\/em> <a href=\\\"https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">in 2003<\/a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/5140246\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/referents/5140245\\\">shed doubt on<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href=\\\"https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\"><em>The Way I Am<\/em><\/a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile<\/em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)<\/p>\\n\\n<p>In 2014, the <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/586290\\\">demo version<\/a> appeared on Shady Records\' <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/114275\\\"><em>SHADY XV<\/em><\/a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/329470\\\">“I Will Always Love You”<\/a> and <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/51652\\\">“End Of The Road”<\/a>). As of 2022, it is <a href=\\\"https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">13x Multi-Platinum<\/a> in the US.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song was lauded critically, too. It won <a href=\\\"https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two Grammys<\/a> (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for <a href=\\\"http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">Best Original Song<\/a>. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href=\\\"https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">didn’t think<\/a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was <a href=\\\"https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">remedied<\/a> when he performed the song at the <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">2020 Oscars<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for <a href=\\\"https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two commercials<\/a> in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">“Born of Fire”<\/a> Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">own fan-made   <script>
  function initialize_wunderkind(d) {
    window.addEventListener('load', function() {
      var e = d.createElement('script');
      e.src = d.location.protocol + '//tag.wknd.ai/5453/i.js';
      e.async = true;
      d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
    });
  }

  function determine_wunderkind_eligibility() {
    if (window.location.search.includes('enable_wunderkind')) {
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
      return;
    }

    let wunderkind_segment = 0;
    try { wunderkind_segment = localStorage.getItem('genius_wunderkind_segment'); } catch (e) {}

    if (typeof(wunderkind_segment) === 'string') {
      wunderkind_segment = Number(wunderkind_segment);
    } else {
      wunderkind_segment = Math.random();
      try { localStorage.setItem('genius_wunderkind_segment', wunderkind_segment); } catch (e) {}
    }

    if ((wunderkind_segment * 100) < 100.0) {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'wunderkind';
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
    } else {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'control';
    }
  }

  determine_wunderkind_eligibility();
</script>

class="About__Container-ut4i9m-1 eSiFpi"><h1 font-size="xxLargeHeadline" class="About__Title-ut4i9m-2 kdlPmS">About</h1><div class="SongDescription__Container-sc-615rvk-0 hGCjqh"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dicydA"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span>Genius Annotation</span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">13 contributors</button></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__Container-sc-1165iv-0 ikywhQ"><div class="ExpandableContent__Content-sc-1165iv-4 huhsMa"><div class="SongDescription__Content-sc-615rvk-2 kRzyD"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 jaueyy"><p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href="https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/38300">8 Mile</a></em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.</p>

<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone</em> <a href="https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300" rel="noopener nofollow">in 2003</a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href="https://genius.com/5140246" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/referents/5140245">shed doubt on</a>.</p>

<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href="https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am" rel="noopener nofollow"><em>The Way I Am</em></a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile</em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)</p>

<p>In 2014, the <a href="https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/586290">demo version</a> appeared on Shady Records' <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/114275"><em>SHADY XV</em></a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.</p>

<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href="https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/329470">“I Will Always Love You”</a> and <a href="https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/51652">“End Of The Road”</a>). As of 2022, it is <a href="https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF" rel="noopener nofollow">13x Multi-Platinum</a> in the US.</p>

<p>The song was lauded critically, too. It won <a href="https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards" rel="noopener nofollow">two Grammys</a> (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for <a href="http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003" rel="noopener nofollow">Best Original Song</a>. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href="https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173" rel="noopener nofollow">didn’t think</a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was <a href="https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/" rel="noopener nofollow">remedied</a> when he performed the song at the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA" rel="noopener nofollow">2020 Oscars</a>.</p>

<p>The song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for <a href="https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot" rel="noopener nofollow">two commercials</a> in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM" rel="noopener nofollow">“Born of Fire”</a> Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw" rel="noopener nofollow">own fan-made song.</a>)</p></div></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__ButtonContainer-sc-1165iv-3 laPHmj"><button class="Button__Container-rtu9rw-0 gexBFu any milestones?</span><button class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 hVAZmF QuestionTemplate__ExpandButton-sc-1is5n1p-5 dHYhwN" type="button"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M0 10h24v4h-24z"></path></svg></button></div><div class="Answer__Container-sc-2neq6u-0 iHvEbL"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dicydA"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span><div class="Answer__AttributionLabel-sc-2neq6u-3 doQBGH">Genius Answer</div></span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">1 contributor</button></div></div><div class="Answer__Body-sc-2neq6u-1 fzIWba"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 jaueyy"><p>As of February 28, 2018, “Lose Yourself” has reached Diamond (10x Multi-Platinum) certification by the <a href="https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF" rel="noopener nofollow">RIAA.</a></p></div></div></div><div class="QuestionAnswerActions__Container-sc-6ne2ji-0 dTXIVU"></div></div><div class="QuestionTemplate__Container-sc-1is5n1p-1 dXxOJg"><div class="QuestionTemplate__Title-sc-1is5n1p-4 eRBluw"><span>Was the song ever performed by Eminem on the Oscars?</span><button class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 hVAZmF QuestionTemplate__ExpandButton-sc-1is5n1p-5 dHYhwN" type="button"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M0 10h24v4h-24z"></path></svg></button></div><div class="Answer__Container-sc-2neq6u-0 iHvEbL"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dicydA"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span><div class="Answer__AttributionLabel-sc-2neq6u-3 doQBGH">Genius Answer</div></span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">1 contributor</button></div></div><div class="Answer__Body-sc-2neq6u-1 fzIWba"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 jaueyy"><p>Though “Lose Yourself” was nominated and won for “Best Original Song” in 2002 at the Oscar’s, Eminem did not perform the song on stage that year. It wasn’t until 18 years later on February 9, 2020 where Eminem made a surprise appearance on the Oscar’s stage to perform the song there for the first time.</p>

src=\'//genius.com/songs/207/embed.js\'><\/script>\",\"descriptionPreview\":\"“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie 8 Mile. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told Rolling Stone in 2003 that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since shed doubt on.\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, The Way I Am, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for 8 Mile] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the demo version appeared on Shady Records\' SHADY XV compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind “I Will Always Love You” and “End Of The Road”). As of 2022, it is 13x Multi-Platinum in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won two Grammys (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for Best Original Song. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he didn’t think he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was remedied when he performed the song at the 2020 Oscars.\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for two commercials in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 “Born of Fire” Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its own fan-made song.)\",\"description\":{\"markdown\":\"\\\"Lose Yourself\\\" is the theme song from Eminem\'s semi-biographical 2002 movie *[8 Mile](http://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile)*. Eminem is narrating the life of the film\'s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem\'s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told *Rolling Stone* [in 2003](https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:\$002f\$002f1657660369\$002f0\$002fazh\$007c\$007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5\$002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl\$002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs\$003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300) that Eminem \\\"laid down all three verses in one take\\\", which Eminem has since [shed doubt on](http://genius.com/5140246).\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, [*The Way I Am*](https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am), that he wrote \\\"in-between shooting scenes [for *8 Mile*] and taking care of [his] kids\\\" (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the [demo version](https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics) appeared on Shady Records\' [*SHADY XV*](http://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv) compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, \\\"Lose Yourself\\\" was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem\'s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind [\\\"I Will Always Love You\\\"](https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics) and [\\\"End Of The Road\\\"](https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics)). As of 2022, it is [13x Multi-Platinum](https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF) in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won [two Grammys](https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards) (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for [Best Original Song](http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003). Eminem didn\'t attend the ceremony as he [didn\'t think](https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173) he\'d win, meaning he didn\'t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was [remedied](https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/) when he performed the song at the [2020 Oscars](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA).\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for [two commercials](https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot) in the mid-\'00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 [\\\"Born of Fire\\\"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM) Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that\'s been meme\'d extensively (even being given its [own fan-made song.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw))\",\"html\":\"<p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/38300\\\">8 Mile<\/a><\/em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone<\/em> <a href=\\\"https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">in 2003<\/a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/5140246\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/referents/5140245\\\">shed doubt on<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href=\\\"https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\"><em>The Way I Am<\/em><\/a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile<\/em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)<\/p>\\n\\n<p>In 2014, the <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/586290\\\">demo version<\/a> appeared on Shady Records\' <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/114275\\\"><em>SHADY XV<\/em><\/a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/329470\\\">“I Will Always Love You”<\/a> and <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/51652\\\">“End Of The Road”<\/a>). As of 2022, it is <a href=\\\"https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">13x Multi-Platinum<\/a> in the US.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song was lauded critically, too. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href=\\\"https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">didn’t think<\/a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. Apple used the song for <a href=\\\"https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two commercials<\/a> in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Disney & Children’s Music\\n•#2 on the All-Time Leaderboard for, Musicals & Broadway\\n\\n•Top Scholars Weekly #122, #123, #125, #127, #137, #139, #140, #141, #142, #144, #145, #146, #148, #149\\n\\n•August, September, October monthly clean-up championships (2020)\\n\\n  \\n\\n\\nMy Genius Journey\\n\\n\\n\\nI initially created a Genius account in 2014 when I was in middle school, but I really only used it to look at lyrics and maybe upvote annotations.\\n\\nI didn’t really become a contributor to the site until April 2020 because of being in quarantine. I started spending a lot of time on here and gained IQ pretty fast, mainly by working meta/transcriptions for Disney and children’s music, which is where over half of my IQ is from.\\n\\nAround June, I began posting in the forums more and participated in the Pride Month Spotlight. Then, in August I participated in and won my first clean-up championship and hit 50,000 IQ. I went on to win the September and October championships as well.\\n\\nIn September, I designed a new cover art for and became a co-host to the Get Involved! community series with ed Scopey, posting biweekly prompts for the Genius community to share about themselves. I also wrote my most upvoted annotation to date about some fun wordplay on Kendrick Lamar’s Pulitzer Prize win for “Friday Night Cypher.”\\n\\nIn October I hit 100,000 IQ! Eminem is narrating…” —@Genius\",\"state\":\"accepted\",\"source\":null,\"shareUrl\":\"https://genius.com/3489948\",\"referentId\":3489948,\"pyongsCount\":7,\"proposedEditCount\":0,\"pinned\":false,\"needsExegesis\":false,\"id\":3489948,\"hasVoters\":true,\"embedContent\":\"<blockquote class=\'rg_standalone_container\' data-src=\'//genius.com/annotations/3489948/standalone_embed\'><a href=\'https://genius.com/3489948/Eminem-lose-yourself/Lose-yourself\'>Lose Yourself<\/a><br><a href=\'https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-lyrics\'>― Eminem – Lose Yourself<\/a><\/blockquote><script async crossorigin src=\'//genius.com/annotations/load_standalone_embeds.js\'><\/script>\",\"deleted\":false,\"customPreview\":null,\"createdAt\":1267583121,\"community\":true,\"commentCount\":3,\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"\\\"Lose Yourself\\\" is the theme song from Eminem\'s semi-biographical 2002 movie *[8 Mile](http://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile)*. Eminem is narrating the life of the film\'s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem\'s journey converge.\\n\\nEngineer Steven King told *Rolling Stone* [in 2003](https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:\$002f\$002f1657660369\$002f0\$002fazh\$007c\$007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5\$002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl\$002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs\$003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300) that Eminem \\\"laid down all three verses in one take\\\", which Eminem has since [shed doubt on](http://genius.com/5140246).\\n\\nEminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, [*The Way I Am*](https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am), that he wrote \\\"in-between shooting scenes [for *8 Mile*] and taking care of [his] kids\\\" (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)\\n\\nIn 2014, the [demo version](https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics) appeared on Shady Records\' [*SHADY XV*](http://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv) compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.\\n\\nCommercially, \\\"Lose Yourself\\\" was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem\'s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind [\\\"I Will Always Love You\\\"](https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics) and [\\\"End Of The Road\\\"](https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics)). As of 2022, it is [13x Multi-Platinum](https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF) in the US.\\n\\nThe song was lauded critically, too. It won [two Grammys](https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards) (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for [Best Original Song](http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003). Eminem didn\'t attend the ceremony as he [didn\'t think](https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173) he\'d win, meaning he didn\'t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was [remedied](https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/) when he performed the song at the [2020 Oscars](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA).\\n\\nThe song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for [two commercials](https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot) in the mid-\'00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 [\\\"Born of Fire\\\"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM) Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that\'s been meme\'d extensively (even being given its [own fan-made song.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw))\",\"html\":\"<p>“Lose Yourself” is the theme song from Eminem’s semi-biographical 2002 movie <em><a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Various-artists/Music-from-and-inspired-by-the-motion-picture-8-mile\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/38300\\\">8 Mile<\/a><\/em>. Eminem is narrating the life of the film’s protagonist, Jimmy, up until the third verse, where Jimmy and Eminem’s journey converge.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Engineer Steven King told <em>Rolling Stone<\/em> <a href=\\\"https://www.vgls.vic.gov.au/client/en_AU/vgls/search/detailnonmodal/eds:%24002f%24002f1657660369%24002f0%24002fazh%24007c%24007c15303517/ada/147dfac4-7ad0-4579-8819-8e2ff29dc5c7.Ujulbmo6f5%24002bZEYQ7Cf3SOTl%24002fq7NA4Wfb31Uu3nxmpvs%24003d?qu=Richman%2C+Daniel%2C+1939-&if=ee%09edsExpanderFacet%09fulltext&d=eds%3A%2F%2F1657660369%2F0%2Fazh%7C%7C15303517%7E1657660369%7E225&ic=true&te=1657660369&av=0&ps=300\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">in 2003<\/a> that Eminem “laid down all three verses in one take”, which Eminem has since <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/5140246\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/referents/5140245\\\">shed doubt on<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Eminem stated in his 2008 autobiography, <a href=\\\"https://www.scribd.com/doc/94728297/The-Way-I-Am\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\"><em>The Way I Am<\/em><\/a>, that he wrote “in-between shooting scenes [for <em>8 Mile<\/em>] and taking care of [his] kids” (pg 108-109.) Scans of the scrawled lyrics on A4 writing pad pages were also featured in the autobiography (pg 217-218.)<\/p>\\n\\n<p>In 2014, the <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Eminem-lose-yourself-original-demo-version-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/586290\\\">demo version<\/a> appeared on Shady Records\' <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Shady-records/Shadyxv\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/114275\\\"><em>SHADY XV<\/em><\/a> compilation album, which featured the same beat and tone but almost entirely different lyrics.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Commercially, “Lose Yourself” was hugely successful and reached #1 in 20 countries, including the US. It marked Eminem’s first US #1, and held the top position for 12 weeks, becoming the third-longest chart-topper from a movie soundtrack (behind <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Whitney-houston-i-will-always-love-you-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/329470\\\">“I Will Always Love You”<\/a> and <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/Boyz-ii-men-end-of-the-road-lyrics\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/songs/51652\\\">“End Of The Road”<\/a>). As of 2022, it is <a href=\\\"https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=EMINEM&ti=LOSE+YOURSELF\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">13x Multi-Platinum<\/a> in the US.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song was lauded critically, too. It won <a href=\\\"https://www.grammy.com/grammys/awards/46th-annual-grammy-awards\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two Grammys<\/a> (Best Male Rap Solo Performance & Best Rap Song) and became the first rap song to win the Oscar for <a href=\\\"http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2003\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">Best Original Song<\/a>. Eminem didn’t attend the ceremony as he <a href=\\\"https://youtu.be/qV4tG-3V3do?t=173\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">didn’t think<\/a> he’d win, meaning he didn’t perform it, which is atypical for winners of the category. This was <a href=\\\"https://variety.com/2020/music/news/eminem-oscar-academy-awards-lose-yourself-exclusive-interview-1203500085/\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">remedied<\/a> when he performed the song at the <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cbtgk20s6wA\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">2020 Oscars<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>The song has also had a huge cultural impact. Apple used the song for <a href=\\\"https://appleinsider.com/articles/05/10/13/apple_pulls_new_eminem_ad_spot\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">two commercials<\/a> in the mid-‘00s to promote iTunes and the iPod, with Eminem featuring in the latter video. Chrysler used the instrumental and Eminem for their 2011 <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mYsFUFgOEmM\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">“Born of Fire”<\/a> Super Bowl commercial. In 2021, Eminem opened up a restaurant in Detroit called “Mom’s Spaghetti”, which is a lyric that’s been meme’d extensively (even being given its <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SW-BU6keEUw\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">own fan-made
